articles.author: Shristi A, Noel Randewich
articles.description: The S&P 500 (.SPX) and Nasdaq (.IXIC) rose on Wednesday as fresh economic data signaled a cooling U.S. economy, reinforcing expectations the Federal Reserve will pause rate hikes in September.
articles.title: Wall St rises as weak economic data fuels rate-pause optimism

articles.author: David Shepardson, Andrea Shalal
articles.description: China's embassy in Washington on Tuesday defended its business practices after U.S. Commerce Secretary Gina Raimondo said U.S. firms had told her that China had become "uninvestible."
articles.title: China, in response to US's Raimondo, says it is easing market access for foreign firms

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The U.S. government has imposed restrictions on some Nvidia (NVDA.O) artificial intelligence chip exports to certain countries in the Middle East, the company said in a regulatory filing this week.
articles.title: US restricts exports of some Nvidia chips to Middle East countries -filing

articles.author: Luc Cohen, Jonathan Stempel
articles.description: A U.S. judge said on Wednesday he would consider delaying Sam Bankman-Fried's Oct. 3 criminal fraud trial, after the jailed FTX founder's lawyers complained he did not have enough time to review millions of pages of evidence to help build his case.
articles.title: Sam Bankman-Fried could have FTX fraud trial delayed

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China's largest private property developer Country Garden (2007.HK) reported on Wednesday a January-June net loss of 48.9 billion yuan ($6.72 billion) versus a 612 million yuan net profit in the same period a year ago.
articles.title: Country Garden posts $6.7 billion net loss in first half

articles.author: Lewis Krauskopf
articles.description: Nvidia Corp’s (NVDA.O) soaring rally has thrilled investors this year - except for the sizeable number of fund managers who avoided what they believe to be an expensive stock.
articles.title: Analysis: Funds punished for owning too few Nvidia shares after stunning 230% rally

articles.author: Daniel Wiessner
articles.description: A California federal judge has refused to dismiss a lawsuit accusing X, the social media service formerly called Twitter, of disproportionately laying off older workers when Elon Musk acquired the company last year.
articles.title: Judge allows age-discrimination lawsuit against Elon Musk's X to proceed

articles.author: Maria Cardona, Marco Bello
articles.description: Hurricane Idalia on Wednesday plowed through the Big Bend region of Florida, where millions of residents had evacuated or hunkered down in anticipation of a dangerous surge of tidal water, but the storm's power ebbed as it headed into Georgia.
articles.title: Hurricane Idalia churns through Florida, threatening storm surge

articles.author: Gerauds Wilfried Obangome
articles.description: Military officers in oil-producing Gabon said they had seized power on Wednesday and had put President Ali Bongo under house arrest, stepping in minutes after the Central African state's election body announced he had won a third term.
articles.title: Gabon officers declare military coup, President Ali Bongo detained

articles.author: Daniel Wiessner
articles.description: The administration of U.S. President Joe Biden on Wednesday moved to extend mandatory overtime pay to 3.6 million salaried workers, going even further than an Obama-era rule that was struck down in court.
articles.title: Biden plan would guarantee overtime pay for 3.6 million workers
